attributes.action: Increase the mental health budget now.
attributes.background: It's a serious issue and affects people’s physical health and the economy. Better prevention measures – access to therapies and support, faster referrals, more time to discuss with a GP versed in mental health – means better outcomes overall. We value mental health and the budget must reflect it!
attributes.additional_details: December 2016: Less and less being spent on mental health: Local authorities use less than 1% of their budget on services

attributes.action: Promote responsible drinking by enforced water stations in pubs, bars and clubs
attributes.background:
Significantly reduce incidents and Public Sectors costs, following other countries' lead by highlighting re-hydration in establishments with alcohol consumption. 
Eliminate queuing up and faux pas amongst peers by having water and electrolyte fluids available in prominent areas relative to capacity
attributes.additional_details:
Alcohol related incidents cost the public sector millions which can be significantly reduced by having easily identifiable water stations in all establishments. 

This can be done by having large containers or a simple bar tap facing the customer and also through encouragement of re-hydration electrolytes in between and after alcoholic drinks. 

NSW in Australia has a similar project already in place and the UK government should follow suit benefiting individuals and the greater community.

attributes.action: Hold A Referendum on whether to accept Freedom of Movement post Brexit.
attributes.background: The public voted to leave the EU. But they did this for a number of reasons, and it should not be assumed this was a direct rejection to the freedom of movement. Negotiations should not be based on the assumption that the UK public disagree with the four key principles, and a vote should be held.
attributes.additional_details:
The Equality and Human Rights Commission (EHRC) itself concluded that “The vast majority of people who voted to leave the European Union did so because they believe it is best for Britain and not because they are intolerant of others.” 
The government should acknowledge the identification of this fact, and the public disapproval of hate crime and xenophobia since the vote, and as such offer the opportunity for the freedom of movement to be decided on.

attributes.action: Make inappropriate/unwanted sexual pictures fall under the indecent exposure law
attributes.background:
Most women are subjected to unwanted sexual/inappropriate pictures from men usually of their penis on most social networking sites or phone apps
I feel this should fall under the indecent exposure laws

attributes.action: Stop government deducting pensions
attributes.background: Stop ex-serviceman having their army pension deducted from their current benefit
attributes.additional_details: Just been called in to the job centre as part of my partner's ESA claim to find out that my army pension will be deducted from her ESA claim at the rate of £25 per week why having served 16 years in the army I know there are people worse off than me but I think it's a crying shame that ex servicemen who have given up their time to serve their country be penalised in later in life please find this position and get the government to change this the pension was rightfully earned and now the government of rightly taking it away from us why

attributes.action: Enforce child protection regulations on all businesses and organisations.
attributes.background: In light of the recent exposure of sexual abuse of children in football there needs to be a way. Child protection appears as a haphazard control with many organisations failing to offer the most basic protection
attributes.additional_details:
There needs to be enforceable rules
All adults must have a DBS
All companies and organisations should be registered with an official body, e.g. Ofsted. All credentials must nbe verified especially when used in advertising and websites. Child referees must be registered with the local authority ( the FA refuse to accept responsibility for children who work as referees) The current position of stating if the parents allow it must be revoked as parents expect official bodies to make competent decisions on their behalf.

attributes.action: make it a criminal offence to not report child abuse to the police.
attributes.background: many hundreds of children have suffered and continue to suffer because of institutional doubt.
attributes.additional_details: This petition is of course supported by the often late action of hundreds of whistle-blowers who should have reported their feelings much earlier than they did. This petition would remove both doubt and onus by making a legally required course of action perfectly clear to all concerned.

attributes.action: To stop the repeal of the Human Rights Act 1998
attributes.background: As part of my citizenship coursework, I am doing a campaign around stop the repeal of the Human Rights Act 1998 and having the law replaced with the British Bill of Rights.

attributes.action: A U.K. Sovereign Wealth Fund for the long term finance of Old Age  Pensions.
attributes.background: Norway's Sovereign Wealth fund is the worlds largest, with over $700bn in assets - this equates to about £130,000 for each Norwegian citizen. Singapore also provides another example that the UK could emulate. Primary function of said fund is to finance Pensions for an increasingly aging population.
attributes.additional_details: North Sea Oil reserves are dwindling but still generate sizeable revenue for the UK Government.  This should be directly invested via a National Wealth Fund with the long term view of funding all pensions. A generous slice of all fuel duty receipt's should also be invested in said fund! As we explore Fracking, NOW is  the time to plan ahead for how revenues will be used! Looking at countries like Norway, Singapore and Qatar, A Sovereign Wealth Fund is long overdue for a country as rich as the UK.

attributes.action: Limit the amount in which uk councils can charge on council tax
attributes.background: Limit the amount councils can charge for council tax as recent years its getting out of control and hitting people hard.Councils also say they have to make cuts yet councils over spend on silly projects and waste money on useless departments. Better surport is needed to be given to those who strugle
attributes.additional_details:
Burton on trent east staffs wasted 30.000 on a plastic ice rink that they made a loss on and sold off for a loss. 

Amber valley wastes money on staff who are unhelpfull and heartless. 

Councils need to offer better surport to those who fall in to bad times not threaten them and make the situation harder.

attributes.action: Scrap High Speed 2 (HS2). Put forward Hyperloop for consideration.
attributes.background:
HS2 provides minimal gains over our existing rail infrastructure. The cost/ benefit ratio is unacceptable to the taxpayer at £55 billion.

If the UK is to spend this sort of money on a transport project, we should be making substantial leaps.
attributes.additional_details:
This could be achieved by implementing Hyperloop technology instead.

With recent announcements from other nations investing in Hyperloop technology, there is a very real worry that if we commit to HS2, the UK will be investing in the wrong choice. 

We'll end up with an overpriced, lacklustre rail technology that is obsolete before the project even gets started.

attributes.action: Create a new licencing law for people transporting horses in trailers
attributes.background: Many people have accidents caused by inexperienced drivers traveling with horse box's (trailers) every day, Usually because these people dont have the experience or training to tow such a heavy loads, People trained to drive B+E vehicles (car & trailer) are trained with empty loads not live animals.
attributes.additional_details:
After careful research I have found that for than 25% of road traffic collisions are caused by people towing horse trailers with horses in them. 
83% of the 25% are motorway collisions causeing full shut downs on the M4 28 times this year alone. 
I believe that new licensing laws are needed for these people that wish to transport their horses around. Especially using the motorway to lower the risk of further accidents and also the trauma this must cause the animals.

attributes.action: Increase public awareness and penalties for using mobiles whilst driving.
attributes.background: A mother and three young children were needlessly killed by a lorry driver using his phone recently. A massive  government information campaign is needed to help stamp this thoughtless practice out, also use of existing cameras for prosecutions and an instant twelve month ban for offenders as in DD.

attributes.action: Agency workers need to be protected against unfair dismissal by law.
attributes.background: After being let go from an agency working position, I realised that agency workers have little to no rights or protection when it comes to unfair dismissal or even being able to have times off for emergencies (unlike their contracted counterparts).

attributes.action: The mandatory installation of an automatic braking system in all lorries
attributes.background: Due to the recent tragic accidental killing of a family of four people by a lorry with a distracted driver, I petition that all lorries be fitted with an mandatory automatic braking system that would come into force if the driver were incapacitated or distracted.

attributes.action: Drivers causing death by dangerous driving should be banned for life,
attributes.background: Due to the amount of fatalities caused by drivers who have no respect for other road users ; mobile phones being a prime example, a car should be classed as a weapon in the wrong hands.

attributes.action: Make students learn how to manage money and finance in secondary schools
attributes.background: Students need to learn how to manage their bills and buy food on set budgets. This can greatly improve the standards of young people so that they can go into the world and know what to do with their wage and their savings, instead of wasting money.

attributes.action: Give English People a vote on if we want Scotland to be given independence.
attributes.background: We keep hearing how Scotland wants its independence and how harsh it is being a part of the United Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details: Give English People a vote on if we want Scotland to be given independence.We keep hearing how Scotland wants its independence and how harsh it is being a part of the United Kingdom. As well as how unfairly Scotland is treated buy the rest of the UK they seem to forget about all the English money that is used to help and support Scotland. So i propose we have a show of hands to see how many people in the rest of the UK would want to become separated from Scotland. I think that Scotland would be shocked at the result of this partition

attributes.action: Make education of communism and its policies mandatory in all education
attributes.background: People need to be aware of the potential of a better life

attributes.action: Decommission Sellafield safely and responsibly, it is too dangerous.
attributes.background:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iUE2846zgCA  
This link shows you a report about the dangers of the SELLAFIELD NUCLEAR INSTALLATION.
I call upon - all people in 200 miles of the SELLAFIELD NUCLEAR INSTALLATION, elected members of the government,  and anyone who loves our country, and its people.
attributes.additional_details:
It came to my attention recently that the Sellafield installation is actually in a state of overloading and dangerously falling into disrepair, due to lack of investment and reductions of staff. 
I ask you all to come together to force the authorities to make the necessary decisions to ensure the safety and security of this installation, which threatens the health and lives of many uk residents.

attributes.action: Allow TV coverage of Saturday 3PM Premier League Matches
attributes.background: In 1964 Burnley chairman Bob Lord was convinced that televising football on a Saturday afternoon would have a detrimental effect on attendances to stadiums. As such, he created a movement to prevent showing these games,  which still stands today.
attributes.additional_details:
I find this notion to be far outdated, especially if you consider these games are shown all over the world apart from where they're being played?! Then consider the rising cost of premium TV services such as Sky and BT Sport yet consumers are not even receiving coverage of half the premier league games. 

I empathise with the desire to keep fans going to the game, I really do. So I'm proposing something similar to the NFL Blackout policy that requires all tickets to be sold 72 hours prior to kickoff or no TV coverage

attributes.action: Pressure NICE to sort out the funding for Bisphosphonates for breast cancer.
attributes.background: Thousands of women are potentially missing out on taking these inexpensive drugs because of the lack of national guidance on who should fund them. It is not clear whether the hospital trust, the local clinical commissioning group (CCG) or NHS England central funding should be paying for them.

attributes.action: Ban all non prescription flea treatment for pets in the UK
attributes.background: With 13 million UK households owning a pet, it's common for people to rely on cheap flea treatment. Some non prescription flea treatments do NOT work effectively and will not kill fleas. Studies find that they may, however, kill your pets.
attributes.additional_details:
Not only do these treatments not work but they may actually be dangerous. 

A simple Google search reveals that hundreds of dogs and cats have fallen victim to the ingredients used in cheaper treatments and hundreds have actually died. 

Whilst it's understandably difficult to afford proper flea treatment, this is the price of having a pet and as their owners, we are fully responsible.

Please sign to make any non prescription flea treatment illegal.

attributes.action: Introduce a mandatory one month driving ban, for mobile phone use whilst driving
attributes.background: The Governments latest proposals, to crack down on mobile phone use whilst driving simply do not go far enough in my honest opinion and I say this not as someone whose life has been affected by this issue, rather that I hope that my friends or myself never will be !
attributes.additional_details:
From the window of my home I have an ideal vantage point to observe traffic as it comes to a halt at a nearby junction and, from the amount of people that I observe using their mobile phones, whilst they are driving it's very clear that the message is simply not getting across !

The introduction of a mandatory one month driving ban, for a first offence in addition to the proposed penalties would in my opinion be a more effective deterrent than what is currently on the table !

attributes.action: Hold a parliamentary debate on the re-introduction of selective State Education
attributes.background: The Government has announced the return of selection in Secondary Education in England without any manifesto commitment or mandate to do so and 40 years after it was abolished as socially divisive and intrinsically unfair to the economically less advantaged.
attributes.additional_details: The Prime Minister argues that the re-introduction of grammar schools will enhance social mobility. However the evidence on the ground in those few areas where selective education remains entrenched is that though it may do so for the lucky few, many more are left behind. Selection favours affluent families who pay for the extra coaching to pass the selection tests and obstructs access for the poorest.

attributes.action: DLA low rate mobility and standard rate pip mobility entitled to a free car
attributes.background: Everybody on mobility part PIP/DLA low rate should be entitled to a free car

attributes.action: Build a minimum of 100,000 social/council houses per year
attributes.background: With immigration at over 300,000 per year for the last 15 years we do not have enough housing. Private landlords are taking over £9bn a year in housing benefit. This money should be spent on building social housing where low income persons can feel secure in a long term tenancy.
attributes.additional_details: The surge in HMO's - House of Multiple Occupancy and extortionate private rents is forcing people to live in poor conditions. Social housing with long term tenancies will help to create a better community where people can call their house a home. Private letting creates a transient community of people leaving and moving every few months and destabilises peoples lives for work, health care and general community cohesion.

attributes.action: Up the fine for driving using a mobile to six points off license and £500.
attributes.background: Everyday I see dozens of drivers flouting this law and families are wrecked as a result. The present penalties are woefully inadequate and provide very little deterrent.

attributes.action: Ban the use of Poultry Manure being spread on fields for agricultural use.
attributes.background: Over the past several years Poultry Manure has been introduced rather than Cow manure on agricultural land. If the wind is blowing just slightly, then you can't go outside the house without the nauseating and gut-wrenching smell that comes off the Manure.

attributes.action: Scrap the 7 day week NHS proposals or fund them by the amount the BMA requires.
attributes.background: The "7 day week" proposals would stretch the already stretched resources and people of the NHS well past breaking point, and do Not provide the funding and staff required. The petition to have Mr Hunt removed was brushed aside, can we at least agree his policies need removing?
attributes.additional_details:
The evidence is in the proposals themselves and the medical practitioner's need to strike over such an unreasonable contract. No further evidence of inadequate provision is required, the burden of proof lies with those trying to push through the contract.
The BMA are the organisation representing the NHS and it's staff.

attributes.action: Get Saddleworth Back Into West riding of Yorkshire; Separate From Oldham!
attributes.background: In 1866 saddleworth became a civil parish in its own right and in 1889 became part of the administrative county of the West Riding of Yorkshire. In 1894 the parish's boundaries were altered with the parts in Quickmere Middle Division (Springhead), Mossley and Uppermill becoming Urban Districts.
attributes.additional_details: The residue became a single-parish rural district. Unfortunately in 1996 the boundaries were changed for the worst & Saddleworth became a part of Oldham, this needs to be reverted back! we should be our own district again belonging to west Yorkshire. please sign this petition to get our boundaries changed back!

attributes.action: Make smoking any substance/cigarette illegal in the UK.
attributes.background: This is a very strong point I feel needs to be raised as the damage caused to bodies and minds from smoking is dangerous and worrying. It rips away at your organs and also influences children and young adults to smoke as they will begin to think it is an okay and unharmful thing to do.

attributes.action: Charge those who misuse public services through drink or drug abuse.
attributes.background: Charge those who misuse public services, such as the ambulance service, police, fire service or the NHS, through drink or drug abuse. Use the money raised through these charges to improve those services, funding things like cancer research, police on the streets, keep hospitals open.
attributes.additional_details:
An article from The Telegraph in 2015 in reference to the government looking into the cost of obesity, drug abuse and alcoholism to the UK economy.

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/health/news/11769531/Cost-of-obesity-drug-abuse-and-alcoholism-to-be-revealed.html

attributes.action: Make it illegal to exclude Legal Expenses cover against Financial Institutions
attributes.background: Family legal expenses policies commonly sold by insurance companies as an add on for about £30 specifically exclude taking any legal action against any insurance company or bank for any insurance contract, savings, pension or investment policy. This should be outlawed as an unfair contract condition
attributes.additional_details: The insurance industry has created a self protection society to the consumer's detriment. The Government has heavily criticised the FCA and the Ombudsman they created and often reach a decisions different to the law. The consumer is at their mercy as without legal expenses cover they can't afford to take action against arrogant, big boy bully insurance providers who just tell the consumer to go away. These policies are consequently worthless in this regard one of the biggest industries in the UK

attributes.action: Offer more medical school places
attributes.background: The GMC limit the number of places avaliable for students studying medicine at university. By keeping the number of places the same, doctors numbers within the NHS won't rise putting patient care at risk. By offering more places longer term the NHS can employ more doctors and improve patient care

attributes.action: Stop the Ministry of Defence (MOD) passing the combat immunity plan
attributes.background: Combat immunity plan will deny soldiers justice. The move to channel complaints into an internal Ministry of Defence compensation scheme will stun the need to prove negligence. "Cases would not be heard by an independent judge, facts would not be independently investigated" Bourns, Law Society
attributes.additional_details:
The Guardian (14th Feb 2017)
Scheme consultation pdf:
https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/573565/20161128-Consultation_document_death_and_injury_compensation_scheme.pdf

attributes.action: Make it an offence to impersonate any of our emergency services.
attributes.background:
At present, in the U.K it is only an offence to impersonate a Police Officer and not any of our other emergency services.
With this loop hole, we have members of the public masquerading as Paramedics, Fire Officers and more. This leaves Police officers powerless to act.
attributes.additional_details:
I have produced a short documentary to prove my point, which you can view here.

https://youtu.be/E4k1NOhABWQ

attributes.action: Reduce alcohol duty. High duty disproportionately penalises the poor.
attributes.background: Higher prices do not prevent alcoholism. Reducing duties to a level similar to Belgium will allow, responsible, poorer drinkers to enjoy better quality drinks without having to sacrifice other things.

attributes.action: Enable Young Couples to Rent by Regulating HMO Licenses
attributes.background:
Young professionals are being forced out of Cities such as Oxford and Cambridge to move back in with their parents due to lack of housing caused by HMO regulations.
We need to have the regulations changed so councils cannot go as low as 2 households / 3 people to require an HMO license.
attributes.additional_details:
Many councils have implemented regulations that prevent more than THREE people residing in a dwelling. Even if TWO of those are a renting couple.

While HMOs may have increased the number of rooms to rent, it is equally removing the amount of available properties for young professionals. Our government should be aware and improve these HMO regulations to ensure more availability.
I strongly believe this will help stabilise housing and help hundreds of individuals who are a value to our cities.

attributes.action: Make it a requirement to teach healthy relationships in schools
attributes.background: i believe the teaching of healthy relationships in school will help to bring the level of domestic abuse down and teach children and young adults what is healthy and what is not and what they can do to protect themselves

attributes.action: Stop all foreign aid except for natural disaster relief.
attributes.background: Use the savings for social care for our elderly and infrastructure projects.

attributes.action: op out of paying into the overseas aid budget and put this to tax to  the NHS
attributes.background: I don't want to put my tax to country's that can afford to send rockets into space when in the uk we have  old people on trolleys in hospital's we need to put the overseas budget to the NHS . if you want to pay into the overseas aid you can op in through the tax system
attributes.additional_details: read the press

attributes.action: PARKING TICKETS: Put clear signage & road markings in restricted parking areas.
attributes.background: Council's should display more signs & have road markings identifying restricted/permit parking areas. Currently, they only have to have a sign on the entrance of the road. These signs can be easily missed, then consequently people are being fined up to £70. This is unfair and needs to be changed.
attributes.additional_details: The requirements for Local Authorities to erect 'Permit Holders Only' repeater signs has been removed which anables the local councils to make more money on these permit holders only areas by not informing the public that the area they are parked in is permit only areas. This is purely a money making scheme and nothing else.

attributes.action: Merge health and social care for the elderly and fund from increased income tax.
attributes.background: A single management line for health and social care would increase efficiency and increased taxation is the fairest way to fund proper care.  Seven day medical and social services would enable capital resources to be better utilised.

attributes.action: Introduce a compulsory quiet time every day to avoid noise pollution for all.
attributes.background: In other countries there are certain times of day when noise pollution is against the law. We would all benefit from knowing we can look forward to a certain time of day when we can be sure we won't be disturbed by other's noise.

attributes.action: request that the government consider 'rewilding' Britain to help save ecosystems
attributes.background: many animals that are now extinct or endangered in this country have been proven to greatly improve the countryside of other countries, such as beavers being effective flood defenders. to restore the natural balance in our ecosystems, the government should consider proposals from Rewilding Britain.
attributes.additional_details: some of the animals considered to be reintroduced are: lynx, beaver, boar, pine martens, many species of birds such as hawks, eagles and owls, marine life including whales and even wolves and bears, although the proposed introduction of these would require consultation with local residents due to ill-deserved stigma and perceived danger (top predators like these usually leave humans alone). when introduced, these animals should be under protection by law from hunting and destruction of habitats.

attributes.action: Article 50 bill to include an executive confirmation referendum on 30/3/2017.
attributes.background: The article 50 act needs to be passed, but should include a 2nd referendum on 30/3/ 17 askng the UK public to confirm their  wish to leave the EU, in light of a very different world outlook. Peers and MPs would be supporting the democracy of the UK, giving the people a final but now informed choice
attributes.additional_details: The politics of the world are very different than 23 June 2016, when Trump and the option of hard Brexit was not a consideration. Much of the argument on both sides has proven to be false. Any reasonable individual would think it only right and proper to reflect and review a decision made in their personal life if circumstances changed. It is only right the UK population is allowed to do the same. A 2nd leave vote would however also give the UK govt a full and informed mandate from the people.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offense to vote against, or block the result of a referendum.
attributes.background:
I find it utterly outrageous that there have been politcians in the goverment who have voted against the brexit referendum despite the people winning there right to freedom.

I propose all referendums are legally binding and to hinder,block or frustrate the process will become a criminal act.
attributes.additional_details: Politicians should brace democratic processes.

attributes.action: Suspend all new legislation and submit to an independent legal compliancy audit
attributes.background: A substantial number of recent legal cases, political events and commentaries on regulatory changes have found the Government to be in breach, de facto and de jure, of a substantial number of its legal obligations under International Law, Human Rights Law, the Constitutional Law of the UK, etc.
attributes.additional_details:
Therefore, the Government should announce legislation to suspend all proposed legislative and regulatory changes, including those made under discretionary (budgetary and departmental) competences, and submit to a full legal compliancy audit by an independent company.

This audit will assess the legality, proportionality and justiciability of current legislation and policy, as well as the role of expert partners, such as the ONS, and stakeholders, in forming Government policy and legislation.

attributes.action: To have all school zones become 20mph for the safety of children.
attributes.background: We expect all of our children to go to school safely often schools are on busy main roads or down country lanes.  Visibility of the children can be poor and parents having to go on to work, parking can also cause a temporary hazard.  We fairly request roads have their speed limits lowered to 20mph.
attributes.additional_details:
The Road Safety Analysis (RSA) body found that there were 85,814 road incidents within a 500 mtr radius of a school equating to more than a 1,000 per month.  In 2014 the Department of Transport confirmed road deaths or serious had risen in each quarter compared to 2013.  In this period the DfT confirmed incidents increased by 6%.

These are frightening figures and it wouldn't take much to put up a few signs telling motorists to reduce their speed to 20mph at national government cost.
